text: 499 West 175th Street at the N.E. corner of Amsterdam Ave. 1932.
Amsterdam Ave., east side, at West 175th Street, showing an old frame mansion bordering on Highbridge Park. April 8,1934.

folder: High Bridge Park & [Amsterdam Avenue & 175th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Highbridge Park: The baseball diamonds north of the reservoir. Buildings shown are on the west side of Amsterdam Ave., north from West 175th Street. The 3½-story frame dwelling is in the park and is the vantage point for No. 2.

April 8, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Improving another diamond. This view is westward and shows High Bridge crossing to the Bronx side of the Harlem River.

October 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A later view, northward. Note the absence of the frame dwelling shown in No. 1.

July 30, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [Amsterdam Avenue - 175th Street (West).]

text:
(1) Overlooking High Bridge Park, north east, to the Washington Bridge; from roof-top at 175th Street and Amsterdam Ave.
October 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) Washington Bridge, north from, above High Bridge.
April 8, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - [View of the bridge from 175th Street and Amsterdam Avenue - High Bridge.]

text:
